verses.verse: Wisdom <WH2454> has built <WH1129> her house, <WH1004> she has hewn <WH2672> out her seven <WH7651> pillars: <WH5982>
She has killed <WH2873> her beasts; <WH2874> she has mingled <WH4537> her wine; <WH3196> she has also <WH637> furnished <WH6186> her table. <WH7979>
She has sent <WH7971> forth her maidens: <WH5291> she cries <WH7121> on the highest <WH4791> places of the city, <WH7176>
Whoever <WH4310> is simple, <WH6612> let him turn <WH5493> in here: as for him that wants <WH2638> understanding, <WH3820> she said <WH559> to him,
Come, <WH3212> eat <WH3898> of my bread, <WH3899> and drink <WH8354> of the wine <WH3196> which I have mingled. <WH4537>
Forsake <WH5800> the foolish, <WH6612> and live; <WH2421> and go <WH833> in the way <WH1870> of understanding. <WH998>
He that reproves <WH3256> a scorner <WH3887> gets <WH3947> to himself shame: <WH7036> and he that rebukes <WH3198> a wicked <WH7563> man gets himself a blot. <WH3971>
Reprove <WH3198> not a scorner, <WH3887> lest <WH6435> he hate <WH8130> you: rebuke <WH3198> a wise <WH2450> man, and he will love <WH157> you.
Give <WH5414> instruction to a wise <WH2450> man, and he will be yet <WH5750> wiser: <WH2449> teach <WH3045> a just <WH6662> man, and he will increase <WH3254> in learning. <WH3948>
The fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068> is the beginning <WH8462> of wisdom: <WH2451> and the knowledge <WH1847> of the holy <WH6918> is understanding. <WH998>
For by me your days <WH3117> shall be multiplied, <WH7235> and the years <WH8141> of your life <WH2416> shall be increased. <WH3254>
If <WH518> you be wise, <WH2449> you shall be wise <WH2449> for yourself: but if you scorn, <WH3887> you alone <WH905> shall bear <WH5375> it.
A foolish <WH3687> woman <WH802> is clamorous: <WH1993> she is simple, <WH6615> and knows <WH3045> nothing. <WH1077> <WH4100>
For she sits <WH3427> at the door <WH6607> of her house, <WH1004> on <WH5921> a seat <WH3678> in the high <WH4791> places of the city, <WH7176>
To call <WH7121> passengers <WH5674> <WH1870> who go right <WH3474> on their ways: <WH734>
Whoever <WH4310> is simple, <WH6612> let him turn <WH5493> in here: and as for him that wants <WH2638> understanding, <WH3820> she said <WH559> to him,
Stolen <WH1589> waters <WH4325> are sweet, <WH4985> and bread <WH3899> eaten <WH398> in secret <WH5643> is pleasant. <WH5276>
But he knows <WH3045> not that the dead <WH7496> are there; <WH8033> and that her guests <WH7121> are in the depths <WH6010> of hell. <WH7585>
